benchmark_details.name: StrucText-Eval
benchmark_details.overview: StrucText-Eval is a benchmark containing 5,800 pre-generated and annotated samples designed to evaluate how well LLMs understand and reason through structured text. It aims to assess LLMsâ€™ ability to interpret structured data presented in unstructured formats across 29 tasks and 8 structured languages.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the reasoning capabilities of large language models (LLMs) on structure-rich text.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: StrucText-Eval includes only eight types of structured languages and encompasses a total of 29 different tasks.

data.source: Pre-generated data based on structured languages designed for evaluating LLMs.

methodology.calculation: Metrics such as RougeL are calculated based on the degree of character-level similarity between model outputs.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better reasoning abilities by LLMs on structure-rich text.
methodology.baseline_results: Open-source LLMs achieved a maximum accuracy of 74.9% on the standard dataset.
methodology.validation: Tested performance using both prompt-based and finetuning methods.
